candidates.title: Reverting aws libs upgrade.
candidates.body:
Upgrading the aws libraries cause the compatibility of this S3 plugin with MinIO to be compromised. Also those libraries are in a beta stage and are likely to change in the near future.

In this commit we also upgrade async rustls.

candidates.title: Storage refactor
candidates.body: Adapting the S3 Storage to the storage manager changes. On hold until those changes are merged.

candidates.title: Adding unstable feature to zenoh dependency, fixing segfault issue
Workspace dependencies
candidates.body: Related to [this](https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/zenoh/pull/420), but here there is actually no need for a workspace since there is a single crate. Versions were matched with main repository.

candidates.title: TLS
candidates.body: This PR allows the user to configure TLS (and thus HTTPS) in order to communicate securely with a MinIO server.

candidates.title: Align with Zenoh Rust new-buffers
candidates.body: Draft PR to be merged after https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/zenoh/pull/383.

candidates.title: S3 Backend first version
candidates.body:
First PR for the Zenoh S3 backend (see the [discussion](https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/roadmap/discussions/53) and the [roadmap issue](https://github.com/eclipse-zenoh/roadmap/issues/54).

The code from this PR has been manually tested with a local instance of a MinIO server running on docker. So far we can:
* Create the storage on a S3 instance retrieving the configuration parameters from the json5 configuration file
* Perform:
  * PUT operations
  * GET operations
  * DELETE operations
* We can delete the bucket upon deletion of the storage (if configured)
* Put/retrieve files with MIME type encoding.

This plugin is compatible with both Amazon and MinIO S3 implementations. Take a look at the readme to see what should be the differences in the config file for each case!

For this feature we are using Amazon's crate [aws-sdk-s3](https://crates.io/crates/aws-sdk-s3) which although is on a beta stage will probably be more fit to support this feature in the future.

**How to run the manual tests**

It is explained on the README document of this PR. Basically:

1 - launch a MinIO instance:
```
docker run -p 9000:9000 -p 9090:9090  --user $(id -u):$(id -g)  --name minio1 -e 'MINIO_ROOT_USER=AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE' -e 'MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD=wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY'  -v ${HOME}/minio/data:/data   quay.io/minio/minio server data --console-address ':9090'"
```

2 - Launch zenohd with the json5 config file from this PR
```
zenohd -c zenoh.json5
```

3 - Perform some of the possible operations using `curl`, for instance:

```
# Put values that will be stored in the S3 storage
curl -X PUT -H 'content-type:application/json' -d '{"example_key": "example_value"}' http://0.0.0.0:8000/s3/example/test

# To get the stored object
curl -X GET -H {} -d '{}' http://0.0.0.0:8000/s3/example/test

# To delete the previous object
curl -X DELETE -H {} -d '{}' http://0.0.0.0:8000/s3/example/test

# To delete the whole storage (and the bucket if configured)
curl -X DELETE 'http://0.0.0.0:8000/@/router/local/config/plugins/storage_manager/storages/s3_storage'

# To delete the whole volume
curl -X DELETE 'http://0.0.0.0:8000/@/router/local/config/plugins/storage_manager/volumes/s3'
```

-----

Observation: this PR is the result of modifying the rocksdb plugin codebase to fit this requirement, so that's why the diffbase will be performed over that code.

chosen_pr.title: Reverting aws libs upgrade.
chosen_pr.body:
Upgrading the aws libraries cause the compatibility of this S3 plugin with MinIO to be compromised. Also those libraries are in a beta stage and are likely to change in the near future.

In this commit we also upgrade async rustls.
